author: jhutchinson
title: Jack Wilshere suffers ANOTHER ankle problem in Bournemouth defeat to Man City… the NINTH of his career
text:
THAT OLD CHESTNUT Jack Wilshere suffers ANOTHER ankle problem in Bournemouth defeat to Man City… the NINTH of his career 
The on-loan Arsenal midfielder was replaced at half-time by Benik Afobe, after injuring himself when trying to challenge David Silva by JOHN HUTCHINSON Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments JACK WILSHERE’S injury jinx struck again last night as Bournemouth fell to a 2-0 home defeat to Manchester City. 
The on-loan Arsenal man felt pain in his ankle at half-time, and was replaced by striker Benik Afobe. Reuters 4 Jack Wilshere was injured in the first half after attempting a tackle on Manchester City’s David Silva 
The injury came as Wilshere attempted a challenge on Manchester City playmaker David Silva. Goals from Raheem Sterling and an own-goal saw Pep Guardiola’s side ease to three points. 
Keep up to date with ALL the BOURNEMOUTH news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Speaking after the game, Cherries boss Eddie Howe attempted to play down the injury, but losing one of his more experienced men against a team chasing the title was a severe blow. JACK'S TALE OF DESPAIR 
October 24, 2009 – Ankle – until Dec 2 (5 1/2 weeks) Jan 8, 2010 – Hamstring – until Feb 9 (4 1/2 weeks) November 14, 2010 – Back – until Nov 23 (1 1/2 weeks) August 1, 2011 – Ankle – until Oct 27 2012 (65 weeks) February 9, 2013 – Hip – until Feb 16 (1 week) March 3, 2013 – Ankle – until April 13 (4 1/2 weeks) May 20, 2013 – Ankle surgery – until July 4 (6 1/2 weeks) October 31, 2013 – Ankle – until November 10 (1 1/2 weeks) Jan 24, 2014 – Ankle – until Feb 8 (2 weeks) March 5, 2014 – Ankle – until May 11 (9 weeks) October 26, 2014 – Ankle/ilness – until Nov 9 (2 weeks) November 22, 2014 – Ankle – until May 4, 2015 (44 weeks) July 31, 2015 – Fibula – until April 24, 2016 (38 weeks) July 31, 2016 – Knee injury – until August 20, 2016 (3 weeks) Reuters Wilshere came off to receive treatment, and was then replaced at half-time be Benik Afobe Related Stories Bel of a fee Manchester United join Man City, Arsenal and Liverpool in race for £85million Torino striker Andrea Belotti STOP RIGHT THERE Manchester United ban residents from using footpaths around Carrington over 'spy' fears Off the Mark Mark Clattenburg is tempted by a move to the MLS or China because of referee scrutiny in Prem Donn a hat, Lukas Ex-Arsenal star Lukas Podolski shocks takeaway customers by working in a KEBAB SHOP on Saturday JESUS WEPT Manchester City ace Gabriel Jesus was substituted after just 14 minutes as he left the field in tears TV TIMES Benfica v Borussia Dortmund: What TV channel is it on and what is the latest team news? Devil's luck Cristiano Ronaldo almost signed for Juventus in 2002 if Marcelo Salas didn't reject a move to Portugal Pretty vacant Arsenal 'deliberately misleading' fans with 'fake' attendances, blasts club's Supporters' Trust White Mart Lane Anthony Martial could be given Man Utd exit route as Spurs mull over stunning swoop for Frenchman Rash move? Marcus Rashford 'stalling over new Manchester United contract' as frustrations grow over lack of game time PREVIEW PSG v Barcelona: What time does the match kick-off, what TV channel is it on, and what is the latest team news? 'It's awful' Aston Villa boss Steve Bruce has blasted his side's form as they lose at home to Ipswich Town on the weekend 
Captain Simon Francis was also injured early on, and had to be replaced by Tyrone Mings. 
He said: “Jack is just feeling his ankle. I don’t think there’s a major injury there. He just felt he couldn’t move as freely as he wanted to and had a pain in his ankle, so we took him off. 
“In terms of effort and commitment, I thought our lads gave everything but, obviously, we were hampered by the injuries. 
“Any injuries we get to established first-team players are going to be difficult to manage. 
“We reorganised and had a go, but ultimately they were too good.” Bournemouth 0-2 Man City : Sterling and Aguero score to keep City in the hunt Reuters 4 Cherries boss Eddie Howe admits Bournemouth are set for a battle for Premier League survival 
Bournemouth fans will be hoping Wilshere will not miss any game time, as the Cherries face being dragged into the relegation mix in the Premier League. 
They are yet to win a game in 2017, and injuries to two key players left boss Howe in no doubt his side are now battling for Premier League survival. 
Howe added: "We go into a little break in the calendar and we have to come back as a refreshed team, ready to fight for our Premier League survival, because we're in no doubts that's the situation we're in. 
"We can grow from this experience and come back a better team." Reuters Wilshere could prove to be an invaluable asset as Bournemouth face being dragged into a relegation battle Goals of the Weekend : Watch the finest strikes from the Premier League 
Bournemouth played with a drive and effort that should serve them well in the battles to come but Howe will have to address a run of seven matches without a win in all competitions, which leaves them only six points above the drop zone. 
Howe said: "In terms of effort and commitment, I thought our lads gave everything but, obviously, we were hampered by the injuries."
